levels.title: Module 1: Fundamentals
levels.subtitle: MCP Server Implementation
levels.description: Implement a fully functional MCP server from scratch, covering the JSON-RPC 2.0 protocol, client-host-server architecture, and tool registration via FastMCP.

phases.title: MCP Architecture Overview
phases.description: Examine the MCP client-host-server architecture, JSON-RPC 2.0 message format, and the role of each component in the protocol stack.

phases.title: Environment Setup
phases.description: Configure a Python development environment using uv, install FastMCP with CLI extras, and initialize the project structure.

phases.title: Tool Implementation
phases.description: Implement your first MCP tool using the @mcp.tool() decorator, define typed parameters, and handle JSON-RPC request/response cycles.

phases.title: Inspector & Debugging
phases.description: Use the MCP Inspector to send test requests, inspect JSON-RPC messages, and debug tool execution before client integration.

phases.title: Client Integration
phases.description: Configure Claude Desktop as an MCP client, register your server via claude_desktop_config.json, and verify end-to-end tool invocation.

levels.title: Module 2: Resources
levels.subtitle: Resource Provider Pattern
levels.description: Build a filesystem-backed MCP resource provider with URI template routing, secure path resolution, and read-only data access patterns.

phases.title: Resources vs Tools
phases.description: Distinguish between MCP's two primary primitives: tools (model-controlled actions) and resources (application-controlled data providers).

phases.title: Project Scaffolding
phases.description: Initialize a new MCP server project with proper directory layout, sample data files, and dependency configuration.

phases.title: Resource URI Templates
phases.description: Implement @mcp.resource() handlers with RFC 6570 URI templates to expose directory listings and file metadata.

phases.title: Secure File I/O
phases.description: Implement file reading with pathlib-based path resolution, directory traversal prevention, and proper error handling.

phases.title: Integration Testing
phases.description: Validate the complete resource provider by testing URI resolution, edge cases, and client-side resource discovery.

levels.title: Module 3: External APIs
levels.subtitle: Async API Integration
levels.description: Integrate external HTTP APIs into an MCP server using async/await patterns, httpx, and TTL-based response caching.

phases.title: External API Patterns
phases.description: Survey common patterns for integrating third-party APIs into MCP servers, including authentication, rate limiting, and error propagation.

phases.title: Dependency Configuration
phases.description: Configure httpx and API key management using environment variables and .env files with python-dotenv.

phases.title: Async HTTP with httpx
phases.description: Implement async MCP tools that perform HTTP requests using httpx.AsyncClient with proper connection lifecycle management.

phases.title: Response Caching
phases.description: Add TTL-based in-memory caching to reduce API calls, with cache invalidation strategies and storage considerations.

phases.title: End-to-End Validation
phases.description: Validate the multi-tool MCP server with Inspector testing, error simulation, and Claude Desktop integration.

levels.title: Module 4: Deployment
levels.subtitle: Production Infrastructure
levels.description: Deploy an MCP server to production using Docker containerization, SSE transport, and Railway cloud hosting with environment configuration.

phases.title: Transport Protocols
phases.description: Compare MCP transport layers: stdio for local IPC and SSE (Server-Sent Events) for remote HTTP-based communication.

phases.title: Docker Containerization
phases.description: Create a production Dockerfile with multi-stage builds, non-root execution, and optimized Python dependency installation.

phases.title: SSE Transport Layer
phases.description: Convert the server from stdio to SSE transport, configure HTTP endpoints, and handle CORS for cross-origin clients.

phases.title: Cloud Deployment (Railway)
phases.description: Deploy the containerized MCP server to Railway, configure environment variables, and set up persistent URLs.

phases.title: Production Readiness
phases.description: Review production concerns including health checks, logging, monitoring, authentication, and scaling strategies for MCP servers.

levels.title: Module 5: Advanced Agents
levels.subtitle: AI Agent Orchestration
levels.description: Master Claude Code agent systems, programmatic agent control via SDK, and multi-agent orchestration for complex AI workflows.

phases.title: Agent Architecture
phases.description: Understand agent capabilities, architectural patterns, and when to use agents vs traditional MCP tools for task delegation.

phases.title: Agent Invocation Tools
phases.description: Build MCP tools that invoke Claude Code agents programmatically for code review and analysis tasks.

phases.title: Agent SDK Integration
phases.description: Use the Agent SDK for programmatic agent control, parallel execution, and custom agent configuration.

phases.title: Multi-Agent Orchestration
phases.description: Design and implement multi-agent systems with specialized agents, state management, and pipeline orchestration.

phases.title: Production Agent Systems
phases.description: Build production-ready agent-aware MCP servers with observability, cost management, and safety controls.

phases.title: Agent Team Coordination
phases.description: Deploy Claude Code agent teams for parallel work with shared task lists and inter-agent messaging.

phases.title: Agent Team Coordination
phases.description: Deploy Claude Code agent teams for parallel work with shared task lists and inter-agent messaging.
